articles.title: Ukraine Launches Major Counter-Offensive in Eastern Donbas Region
articles.snippet: Ukrainian forces have launched a significant counter-offensive operation in the eastern Donbas region, recapturing several key positions according to military officials in Kyiv.

articles.title: Trump Announces Sweeping New Tariffs on European Union Steel and Aluminum
articles.snippet: President Trump announced a new round of tariffs targeting European steel and aluminum imports, escalating trade tensions with the bloc and prompting swift condemnation from Brussels.

articles.title: Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Talks Resume in Cairo Amid Rising Tensions
articles.snippet: Negotiations between Israeli and Hamas delegations have resumed in Cairo, with mediators pushing for an extended ceasefire amid escalating humanitarian concerns in Gaza.

articles.title: China Conducts Large-Scale Military Exercises Near Taiwan Strait
articles.snippet: China's People's Liberation Army has begun large-scale military exercises in the waters surrounding Taiwan, deploying naval vessels and aircraft in what Beijing calls routine training.

articles.title: NATO Allies Agree to Boost Defense Spending to 3% of GDP
articles.snippet: NATO member states have reached a preliminary agreement to raise their defense spending targets to 3% of GDP, responding to growing security threats on the alliance's eastern flank.

articles.title: Sudan Conflict Displaces Another 500,000 as Fighting Intensifies in Khartoum
articles.snippet: The ongoing conflict in Sudan has displaced an additional half million people as fighting between the army and Rapid Support Forces intensifies in the capital Khartoum.

articles.title: Senate Blocks White House Spending Bill in Late Night Vote
articles.snippet: The US Senate voted down the administration's latest spending proposal in a dramatic late-night session, with several Republican senators joining Democrats in opposition.

articles.title: Putin Warns of Consequences if Western Arms Continue Flowing to Ukraine
articles.snippet: Russian President Vladimir Putin issued a stern warning to Western nations, saying continued arms deliveries to Ukraine would have serious consequences for European security.

articles.title: OPEC+ Debates Production Cuts as Oil Prices Slide Below $70
articles.snippet: OPEC+ members are considering deeper production cuts as crude oil prices continue their downward trend, falling below $70 per barrel for the first time in months.

articles.title: India and Japan Sign Major Defense Cooperation Agreement
articles.snippet: India and Japan have signed a landmark defense cooperation agreement covering joint military exercises, technology sharing, and maritime security in the Indo-Pacific region.

articles.title: Houthi Rebels Launch New Attacks on Commercial Shipping in Red Sea
articles.snippet: Yemen's Houthi rebels have launched another wave of attacks on commercial vessels in the Red Sea, forcing major shipping companies to reroute around the Cape of Good Hope.

articles.title: EU Imposes New Sanctions Package on Russia Targeting Energy Sector
articles.snippet: The European Union has adopted its latest package of sanctions against Russia, targeting key energy companies and introducing new restrictions on technology exports.

articles.title: North Korea Tests New Ballistic Missile Capable of Reaching US Mainland
articles.snippet: North Korea has conducted a test launch of a new intercontinental ballistic missile, with analysts estimating it has the range to strike the continental United States.

articles.title: Macron Calls for European Strategic Autonomy in Major Defense Speech
articles.snippet: French President Emmanuel Macron delivered a major address calling for European strategic autonomy, arguing the continent can no longer rely solely on American security guarantees.

articles.title: Congress Demands Briefing on Classified Intelligence Sharing with Allies
articles.snippet: Bipartisan lawmakers are demanding a classified briefing from intelligence agencies regarding the scope and protocols of intelligence sharing arrangements with allied nations.

articles.title: Xi Jinping Meets South China Sea Claimant Nations in Beijing Summit
articles.snippet: Chinese President Xi Jinping has convened leaders from Southeast Asian nations with competing South China Sea claims in a summit aimed at establishing a new code of conduct.

articles.title: Zelenskyy Urges Faster Western Weapons Deliveries in Emotional Address
articles.snippet: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy delivered an emotional address to European leaders, urging faster delivery of promised weapons systems as front-line conditions deteriorate.

articles.title: Federal Reserve Signals Potential Rate Cut Amid Economic Slowdown
articles.snippet: Federal Reserve officials have signaled openness to cutting interest rates in the coming months as economic indicators point to a slowdown in growth and consumer spending.

articles.title: Ethiopia-Eritrea Border Tensions Flare as Troops Mobilize
articles.snippet: Tensions between Ethiopia and Eritrea have escalated sharply, with both nations reportedly mobilizing military forces along their shared border amid a collapse in diplomatic talks.

articles.title: Iran Nuclear Talks Hit Impasse Over Enrichment Levels
articles.snippet: International negotiations over Iran's nuclear program have reached an impasse, with Tehran refusing to reduce uranium enrichment levels below 60 percent as demanded by Western powers.

articles.title: South Korea Announces $50 Billion Semiconductor Investment Plan
articles.snippet: South Korea has unveiled a massive $50 billion investment plan to expand domestic semiconductor manufacturing capacity, aiming to reduce dependence on global supply chains.

articles.title: Kremlin Dismisses Peace Proposal as Unacceptable, Demands Territory Recognition
articles.snippet: The Kremlin has dismissed the latest international peace proposal for Ukraine as unacceptable, reiterating its demand for recognition of territorial gains before any ceasefire.

articles.title: UK Prime Minister Starmer Faces Backbench Revolt Over Defense Budget
articles.snippet: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer is facing a growing rebellion from Labour backbenchers opposed to increasing the defense budget to meet NATO's new 3% GDP spending target.

articles.title: Global Shipping Costs Surge 40% Due to Red Sea Crisis and Trade Disruptions
articles.snippet: Global container shipping costs have surged by 40% as the ongoing Houthi attacks in the Red Sea and new trade barriers disrupt major commercial routes worldwide.

articles.title: Nigeria Deploys Military to Combat Rising Insurgency in North-East
articles.snippet: The Nigerian military has launched a new operation in the country's north-east to counter a resurgence of militant activity, deploying additional troops and air assets to the region.
